meanings.definition: Distribute or allocate (something) differently or again
meanings.sent1: After the storm, they had to reapportion the food supplies to ensure everyone had enough.
meanings.sent2: The teacher decided to reapportion the group projects to give each student a fair share of the work.
meanings.sent3: The party planner had to reapportion the seating arrangements when unexpected guests arrived.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, you must constantly reapportion your pieces to adapt to your opponent's moves.
meanings.sent5: To successfully manage a budget, you need to regularly reapportion your expenses based on your priorities.
